content.title: National Agriculture Market
content.department: Ministry Of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
content.details: e-National Agriculture Market (e-NAM) is a pan-India electronic trading portal that networks the existing APMC/Mandis to create a unified national market for agricultural commodities. Launched on 14th April 2016, it aims to facilitate pan-India trade in agricultural commodities.
benefits: Stable Price and Availability to Consumers
eligibility: States/UTs must undertake mandatory reforms in their APMC Acts including single trading license valid across the State, single point levy of market fee, and provision for e-auction/e-trading.
content.application_process: Online registration is required for farmers and traders through the e-NAM portal.

faqs.question: What is the difference between e-NAM and the existing mandi system?
faqs.answer: e-NAM is not a parallel marketing structure but rather a device to create a national network of physical mandis which can be accessed online.

faqs.question: How will e-NAM operate?
faqs.answer: The e-NAM electronic trading platform has been created with an investment by the Government of India and offers a 'plug-in' to any market yard existing in a State.

faqs.question: Are there any conditions for joining e-NAM?
faqs.answer: States interested to integrate their mandis with e-NAM are required to carry out three reforms in their APMC Act.

faqs.question: Will the APMC mandis lose out business due to e-NAM?
faqs.answer: Mandis do not lose any business. e-NAM increases the choice of the farmer when selling produce.

faqs.question: Who will actually operate the e-NAM platform?
faqs.answer: Ministry of Agriculture & Farmers' Welfare, Govt. of India has appointed Small Farmers' Agribusiness Consortium (SFAC) as the Lead Implementing Agency.
